alert.note: Alert for De Baca County; Guadalupe County; Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN DE BACA, SOUTHWESTERN QUAY AND EAST CENTRAL GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM MDT... At 414 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Sumner Lake State Park to near Fort Sumner to 16 miles southeast of Yeso. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Sumner and Taiban. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 318 and 342. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: De Baca County; Guadalupe County; Quay County
